comments:
Using the TPTP-4.3.0-200610170100 driver on Windows-IA32, I keep getting the attached error messages after profiling the workbench several times.  It works fine for the first few launches, but it starts giving the attached error messages shortly after.  There are no error messages logged in AC's log file, but the following is logged in Eclipse's log file (indicating an NPE in ProcessImpl):

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ProcessImpl.getConsole(ProcessImpl.java:380)
at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.deleg.application.PIDelegateHelper.verifyValidJVMVersion(PIDelegateHelper.java:440)
at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.deleg.application.PIRuntimeWorkbenchLauncherDelegate.preLaunch(PIRuntimeWorkbenchLauncherDelegate.java:39)
at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.core.LauncherUtility.delegateInit(LauncherUtility.java:1162)
at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:188)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:797)
The only workaround I found for this problem is to shutdown both Eclipse and Agent Controller and restart them again.

'util' is actually from the "BaseConnectUtil" class of the "org.eclipse.tptp.platform.common" plugin as a result of plugin restructuring in 4.3. Is it possible for you to get the "result" value returned from "util.connect()"? I cannot reproduce it myself after profiling the workbench many times.

Samson, I'm only able to reproduce this problem on the TPTP-4.3.0-200610170100 driver. I can't reproduce it on the TPTP-4.3.0-200610260100 driver.  I'm going to mark it as INVALID for now and I'll reopen it if I experience the problem again.
